change.summary: API for pinned Watches
change.description: A Watch.Pin base interface introduced as a basis for specific platform-dependent and location-dependent implementations. DebuggerManager.createPinnedwatch() introduced.

change.summary: API for changing enabled state of a Watch
change.description: Two method are added to Watch class: isEnabled() and setEnabled(boolean). When the enabled state changes, PROP_ENABLED event is fired.

change.summary: Use of some generic types in API; ContextProvider implemented more broadly; DebuggerManager.join

compatibility.p: As with any generification, it is possible for old code to no longer compile. E.g.

description.p: ContextProvider is now properly generified, and implemented also by:
The new method DebuggerManager.join can be used to merge lookup lists easily.

change.summary: Support for "dual" actions added.
change.description:
According to Debugger UI Specification there are some actions that have two different meanings. for example Step Into action. When some Java Debugger session is running it steps into the current method. But if there is no session running it should start a new session for Main Project and stop in its main method. Thats why we have to update support for debugger actions. Changes made:
Support methods for managing and sharing actions has been moved from DebuggerEngine to new class ActionsManager.
Debugger Action Constants has been move from DebuggerEngine to ActionsManager.
New common ancestor of DebuggerManager, Session and Debugger Engine has been introduced - LookupProvider. From now you can register the same action in differen context levels.
DebuggerManager.getActionsManager () method has been added. You can register ActionProviders for default root context (managed by DebuggerManager). These actions can be in enabled state even if there is no current DebuggerEngine!
DebuggerEngine parameter of method ActionsProvider.doAction (...) has been removed.

change.summary: Support for synchronouous start of DebuggerEngines added.

description.p: void DebuggerManager.startDebugging (DebuggerInfo) has been changed to DebuggerEngine[] DebuggerManager.startDebugging (DebuggerInfo). So it returns array of all DebuggerEngines created for given DebuggerInfo.

change.summary: Support for ToggleBreakpointAction added, and some bugfix of Debugger Actions support API.

description.p: ActionsManager.doAction (...), ActionsProvider.doAction (...) and ActionsManagerListener.actionPefrormed (...) methods will not return boolean any longer. This parameter was unusefull and it was not posible to implement it in some meaningful way.

change.summary: Support for Breakpoints Group added.

description.p: Breakpoint.getGroupName (), Breakpoint.setGroupName () methods were added. Breakpoint.PROP_GROUP_NAME has been added.

change.summary: final modifier removed from ActionsProviderSupport.isEnabled.

description.p: Having final modifier for this method can be too obstructive in some cases. I had a problem writing tests.

change.summary: Debugger actions can be posted asynchronously.

description.p: Added methods: ActionsManager.postAction(Object), ActionsProvider.postAction(Object, Runnable), These can be used to call and implement asynchronous actions.

change.summary: Support for stepping over operations.

description.p: Added fields: ActionsManager.ACTION_STEP_OPERATION, This constant is used in action performer which implements an operation step.

change.summary: Support for breakpoint validity.

description.p:
Added fields: Breakpoint.PROP_VALIDITY - This constant is used in property change events as a notification about change in validity.
Breakpoint.VALIDITY - enumeration of constants for breakpoint validity.
Added methods: Breakpoint.getValidity(), Breakpoint.getValidityMessage(), Breakpoint.setValidity() - validity management.

change.summary: Add filter for hit counts to breakpoints.

description.p: To be able to set breakpoint for number of iterations, we need to add a filter for hit counts into Breakpoint API.

Added methods:
Breakpoint.getHitCountFilter(), Breakpoint.getHitCountFilteringStyle(), Breakpoint.setHitCountFilter().

Added fields:
Breakpoint.PROP_HIT_COUNT_FILTER, Breakpoint.HIT_COUNT_FILTERING_STYLE.

change.summary: Lookup improvements and service annotation registration.

description.p: In order to be able to register debugger services on System FileSystem, which brings more flexibility and better performance (see also ), we add non-recursive content of org.openide.util.Lookups.forPath() into debugger lookup. Since debugger needs retrieve context-aware services from the lookup, ContextAwareService interface is introduced.

Annotations are added for easy registration on module layers. DebuggerServiceRegistration to register implementations of interfaces, *Provider.Registration to register implementations of appropriate providers.

change.summary: Support for providing initial values of properties.

description.p: Properties.Initializer interface introduced to provide initial values of properties. This is necessary when properties are accessed from more places and it's not practical to copy default values to every such location.

change.summary: Support for listening to changes of property values.

description.p: addPropertyChangeListener() and removePropertyChangeListener() methods added to Properties class.

change.summary: Support for changing the order of watches.

description.p:
createWatch(int index, String expr) and reorderWatches(int[] permutation) methods added to DebuggerManager class.
These methods are going to be called from WatchesTreeModel when watches are reordered.

change.summary: A declarative mechanism to delay creation of action provider instance until a file with specific MIME type becomes active.

description.p: ActionsProvider.Registration annotation is enhanced with two additional methods actions() and activateForMIMETypes(). Until a file with the listed MIME type is selected in the IDE, the appropriate actions provider is left disabled for the given list of actions, without instantiating the implementation class.

change.summary: It's possible to override New Watch action with a session-specific provider.

description.p: ActionsManager.ACTION_NEW_WATCH constant was added for use by session-specific provider of New Watch action. That action invokes an implementation of ActionsProvider that is registered for the active debugger session and contains ActionsManager.ACTION_NEW_WATCH action.

change.summary: Breakpoints group properties.

description.p: Add Breakpoint.getGroupProperties() method, that returns an implementation of GroupProperties class with the relevant grouping information used by BreakpointsWindow to create hierarchy of breakpoint groups

change.summary: Allow multiple debugger service registrations and position order

description.p: Allow to specify the order of the debugger service registry. For the need of being able to define multiple different registrations for a single instance, @DebuggerServiceRegistrations and ActionsProvider.Registrations annotations are introduced.

change.summary: Evaluate action is made generic, based on action providers.

description.p: Evaluate action is moved from JPDA Debugger into Debugger Core UI module. ActionsManager.ACTION_EVALUATE constant was added for use by debugger-specific provider (ActionsProvider) of Evaluate action.

change.summary: Added a possibility to enable/disable other breakpoints when one is hit.
change.description:
Four methods are added to the Breakpoint class, that allow to get or set a set of breakpoints, that are enabled or disabled when the breakpoint is hit. One test method is provided, which determines if the dependent breakpoints are supported by the implementation.
Added methods:
Breakpoint.canHaveDependentBreakpoints(), Breakpoint.getBreakpointsToEnable(), Breakpoint.setBreakpointsToEnable(), Breakpoint.getBreakpointsToDisable(), Breakpoint.setBreakpointsToDisable().

change.summary: A session bridge introduced to handle mixed languages debugging.
change.description: SessionBridge class introduced. This class allows to suggest that some debug action can be handled by a different debugging session. The handlers can be registered via implementations of SessionChanger interface.

change.summary: A mechanism for activation/deactivation of engine-related breakpoints.
change.description: API class ActiveBreakpoints and SPI interface BreakpointsActivationProvider introduced. These classes handle an activation/deactivation of engine-related breakpoints, which is independent on their enabled/disabled state.

head.title: Debugger Core API changes by date

body.p: This document lists changes made to the Debugger Core APIs. Please ask on the nbdev@netbeans.org mailing list if you have any questions about the details of a change, or are wondering how to convert existing code to be compatible.
